1.name: Bride of Frankenstein
1.description: Mary Shelley reveals the main characters of her novel survived: Dr. Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

2.name: The Girl from 10th Avenue
2.description: When his fiancée Valentine dumps him, prominent lawyer Geoffrey Sherwood goes on a bender and winds up married to a stranger, Miriam Brady. They decide to give their marriage a chance. ...                See full summary »

3.name: The 39 Steps
3.description: A man in London tries to help a counter-espionage Agent. But when the Agent is killed, and the man stands accused, he must go on the run to save himself and stop a spy ring which is trying to steal top secret information.

4.name: A Night at the Opera
4.description: A sly business manager and two wacky friends of two opera singers help them achieve success while humiliating their stuffy and snobbish enemies.

5.name: Mutiny on the Bounty
5.description: A tyrannical ship captain decides to exact revenge on his abused crew after they form a mutiny against him, but the sailor he targets had no hand in it.

6.name: Top Hat
6.description: An American dancer comes to Britain and falls for a model whom he initially annoyed, but she mistakes him for his goofy producer.

7.name: Magnificent Obsession
7.description: The life of spoiled rich Robert Merrick is saved through the use of a hospital's only resuscitator, but because the medical device cannot be in two places at once, it results in the death ...                See full summary »

8.name: The Personal History, Adventures, Experience, & Observation of David Copperfield the Younger
8.description: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

9.name: Werewolf of London
9.description: The juice of a rare Tibetan flower is the only thing that keeps Dr. Glendon from turning into a werewolf during a full moon.

10.name: Curly Top
10.description: Wealthy Edward Morgan becomes charmed with a curly-haired orphan and her pretty older sister Mary and arranges to adopt both under the alias of "Mr. Jones." As he spends more time with them, he soon finds himself falling in love with Mary.

11.name: A Tale of Two Cities
11.description: A pair of lookalikes, one a former French aristocrat and the other an alcoholic English lawyer, fall in love with the same woman amongst the turmoil of the French Revolution.

12.name: Les Misérables
12.description: In early 19th Century France an ex-convict who failed to report to parole is relentlessly pursued over a 20 year period by an obsessive policeman.

13.name: A Midsummer Night's Dream
13.description: Theseus, Duke of Athens, is going to marry Hyppolyta, Queen of the Amazons. Demetrius is engaged with Hermia, but Hermia loves Lysander. Helena loves Demetrius. Oberon and Titania, of the ...                See full summary »

14.name: Anna Karenina
14.description: The married Anna Karenina falls in love with Count Vronsky despite her husband's refusal to grant a divorce, and both must contend with the social repercussions.

15.name: Captain Blood
15.description: After being wrongly convicted as a traitor, Peter Blood, an English physician, is sent to exile in the British colonies of the Caribbean, where he becomes a pirate.

16.name: The Raven
16.description: A brilliant surgeon obsessed with Edgar Allan Poe saves the life of a beautiful dancer and goes mad when he can't have her.

17.name: The Devil Is a Woman
17.description: A young man is warned by a captain about a temptress; nonetheless, he finds himself falling in love with her.

18.name: Call of the Wild
18.description: During the Klondike Gold Rush, a traveler purchases a dog to lead the way toward the treasure, but reconsiders his journey when he finds a jilted married woman.

19.name: Mark of the Vampire
19.description: When a nobleman is murdered, a professor of the occult blames vampires; but not all is what it seems.

20.name: The Informer
20.description: In 1922, an Irish rebel informs on his friend, then feels doom closing in.

21.name: Mad Love
21.description: In France, an insane surgeon's obsession with an actress from England leads him to replace her pianist husband's hands that got mangled in an accident with the hands of a late knife murderer which still have the urge to throw knives.

22.name: Crime and Punishment
22.description: Man is haunted by a murder he's committed.

23.name: The Phantom Empire
23.description: When the ancient continent of Mu sank beneath the ocean, some of its inhabitant survived in caverns beneath the sea. Cowboy singer Gene Autry stumbles upon the civilization, now buried ...                See full summary »

24.name: Dante's Inferno
24.description: Jim Carter moves in on the McWade's carnival concession which shows scenes from Dante's "Inferno". He makes it a going concern, marrying Betty along the way. An inspector calls the ...                See full summary »

25.name: Sylvia Scarlett
25.description: When her father decides to flee to England, young Sylvia Scarlett must become Sylvester Scarlett and protect her father every step of the way, with the questionable help of plenty others.

26.name: She
26.description: Leo Vincey, told by his dying uncle of a lost land visited 500 years ago by his ancestor, heads out with family friend Horace Holly to try to discover the land and its secret of immortality...                See full summary »

27.name: Gun Smoke
27.description: Parker, seeking revenge on Culverson, is bringing in a flood of sheep. Branning signs on at the Culverson ranch to help fight them off. Standing in his way is hired gunman and crooked ...                See full summary »

28.name: The Crusades
28.description: King Richard and the Third Crusade (1190-1192) are given the DeMille treatment with more spectacle than history.

29.name: The Good Fairy
29.description: A naive girl just out of a cloistered orphanage finds that being a 'good fairy' to strangers makes life awfully complicated.

30.name: The Lives of a Bengal Lancer
30.description: Three British soldiers on the Northwest Frontier of India struggle against the enemy - and themselves.

31.name: Becky Sharp
31.description: Set against the background of the Battle of Waterloo, Becky Sharp is the story of Vanity Fair by Thackeray. Becky and Amelia are girls at school together, but Becky is from a "show biz" ...                See full summary »

32.name: Roberta
32.description: In Paris, a man clueless about fashion suddenly inherits his aunt's dress shop, while his bandleader friend reunites with his old flame.

33.name: 'G' Men
33.description: It's the early days of the F.B.I. - federal agents working for the Department of Justice. Though they've got limited powers - they don't carry weapons and have to get local police approval ...                See full summary »

34.name: Alice Adams
34.description: The misadventures of two social-climbing women in small town America.

35.name: Border Brigands
35.description: Canadian Mountie goes undercover to catch his brother's killers.

36.name: Suicide Squad
36.description: Larry Baker is a young fireman whose daring exploits have led him to receiving a lot of newspaper publicity which goes to his head. His sweetheart, Mary O'Connor, and fire-department ...                See full summary »

37.name: Dangerous
37.description: An alcoholic actress who is considered a dangerous jinx is rehabilitated, but she then shows that she's as dangerous as ever.

38.name: Barbary Coast
38.description: Mary Rutledge arrives from the east, finds her fiance dead, and goes to work at the roulette wheel of Louis Charnalis' Bella Donna, a rowdy gambling house in San Francisco in the 1850s. She...                See full summary »

39.name: Steamboat Round the Bend
39.description: A Louisiana con man enters his steamboat into a winner-take-all race with a rival while trying to find a witness to free his nephew, about to be hung for murder.

40.name: The Little Colonel
40.description: After Southern belle Elizabeth Lloyd runs off to marry Yankee Jack Sherman, her father, a former Confederate colonel during the Civil War, vows to never speak to her again. Several years ...                See full summary »

41.name: The Littlest Rebel
41.description: Shirley Temple's father, a rebel officer, sneaks back to his rundown plantation to see his family and is arrested. A Yankee takes pity and sets up an escape. Everyone is captured and the ...                See full summary »

42.name: Scrooge
42.description: Scrooge, the ultimate Victorian miser, hasn't a good word for Christmas, though his impoverished clerk Cratchit and nephew Fred are full of holiday spirit. But in the night, Scrooge is ...                See full summary »

43.name: The Last Days of Pompeii
43.description: In the doomed Roman city, a gentle blacksmith becomes a corrupt gladiator, while his son leans toward Christianity.

44.name: Charlie Chan in Egypt
44.description: While investigating the theft of antiquities from an ancient tomb excavation, Charlie discovers that the body of the expedition's leader concealed inside the mummy's wrappings.

45.name: The Black Room
45.description: Ignoring an ancient prophecy, evil brother Gregor seeks to maintain his feudal power on his his Tyrolean estate by murdering and impersonating his benevolent younger twin.

46.name: Ruggles of Red Gap
46.description: An English valet brought to the American west assimilates into the American way of life.

47.name: Bordertown
47.description: Embittered when prejudice cuts short his nascent law career, once-idealistic Johnny Ramirez leaves his home in Los Angeles and ends up in Mexico. He quickly becomes the invaluable ...                See full summary »

48.name: The Ghost Goes West
48.description: A haunted Scottish castle is dismantled and transported to Florida, bringing the family ghost along with it.

49.name: Reckless
49.description: Wealthy Bob Harrison buys all the seats in the theatre to watch Mona Leslie's musical by himself. He loves her, her agent Ned Riley loves her. Conflict ensues.

50.name: Charlie Chan in Paris
50.description: Hired to investigate forged bonds, Charlie is thwarted by the murder of his undercover agent, but the arrival of son Lee helps him uncover the true culprits.
